alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 1:10AM EDT until July 09 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTHWEST Kentucky and south central Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTHWEST Kentucky, Ohio. In south central Kentucky, Butler. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1209 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hartford, Morgantown, Casey, Beaver Dam, Centertown, Mchenry, Rockport, Rochester, Woodbury, and Shultztown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is especially dangerous in the dark.
